intro: Daphne oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu daphne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central disk. Due to habitat loss, Daphne oahuensis is considered endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts to protect this unique species.
